2008/4/23 jensnz <jensnz@...>:
>  The background of my question is the following: I want to use tests in
>  a scenario where interfaces describe services (like in OSGI). When a
>  service becomes available (a class implementing the interface), I want
>  to run all tests for this service at runtime (!) to verify that the
>  service has the correct behaviour. I cannot do this at build time as
>  the service is discovered dynamically and I don't own the
>  implementation. So I somehow have to inject the service implementation
>  into the test case before setUp is executed.

It sounds as if you need to run the service loading framework in your
test set-up to load the services you want totest.

I'm not sure what you mean by distinguishing between build time and run-time.

--Nat
